pullRequest.title: Improve MFA:Gauth: TOTP HTTP request logging

beforeCommit.message:
mfa:gauth: Embed QRCode image in registration template

An HTTP endpoint [0] currently serves the purpose of grabbing the user's
TOTP secret key and produce the required QR code that in turn gets
scanned by the user's phone.

A security issue arises in the Google Authenticator registration
template [1] because the aforementioned HTTP endpoint is sourced in an
`img` tag, passing the user's secret key as a GET parameter. This poses
an immediate threat to the confidentiality of the key.
GET parameters get logged in proxies (e.g. Load balancers, reverse
proxies etc), hence CAS users might be unknowingly logging these.

Provide the registration template with the QR code image, base64 encode
it and embed it using the `base64:image/png` scheme.

[0]: https://github.com/apereo/cas/blob/acdc6cfd9e919e7feb54ad1ad0cbea44db88733d/support/cas-server-support-otp-mfa-core/src/main/java/org/apereo/cas/otp/web/flow/rest/OneTimeTokenQRGeneratorController.java#L28
[1]: https://github.com/apereo/cas/blob/c839b62772078bf347c45e67bb2b51d0aa622ff0/support/cas-server-support-thymeleaf/src/main/resources/templates/casGoogleAuthenticatorRegistrationView.html#L108

nodes.bodyText: Remove "data:image/png;base64," and move it over to the actual template to be consistent with other areas in CAS doing the same.
Renaming a flow-scope variable will surely break tests. Please review and adjust.
